intro: Cynoglossum nova-guineese, commonly known as the New Guinea ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
